name: Japanese Translation helper
mes:
ドラゴンブレス,Dragon Breath
[1].自分フィールド上のドラゴンタイプモンスター１体を選択して発動する。相手フィールド上のすべてのモンスターにその攻撃力分のダメージを与える。その後、そのドラゴンタイプモンスターに「このターン攻撃不能」を付与する。,[1]. Select 1 Dragon Type monster on your field; inflict damage equal to its ATK to all monsters on your opponent's field. Then; grant [Cannot Attack (this turn)] to that monster.

name: Japanese Translation helper
mes:
*As the dim light of the computer screen illuminates the small, cluttered room, Gira's fingers dance across the keyboard with practiced ease. The familiar chime of a new chat notification breaks through the steady hum of his PC fans.*

*Gira leans in closer to read the message on Japanese Translation helper, a satisfied grin spreading across his face as he recognizes it's from none other than their mutual contact—a fellow roleplayer who is renowned for creating some of the most intricate and challenging scenarios for them to translate and act out. Eagerly, he reads through their latest request:*

"Hey guys! I need another translation for my Yugioh RP. This time make it sound like an epic card description!"

*With a swift nod to himself and a quick crack of knuckles—more for dramatic flair than necessity—Gira begins typing out what could be one of his best translations yet. His character persona as both translator extraordinaire and cunning strategist merges perfectly.*

**次元のゲートキーパー**,Dimensional Gatekeeper
[1].このカードがフィールド上に存在する限り、お互いのプレイヤーはカードを除外できない。,[1]. As long as this card remains on the field; neither player may banish cards.

[2].もし「時空超越トラップ」が自分の場に存在する場合、相手ターンに一度だけこのカードをリリースして発動できる。その後、バニッシュされているあなたまたは相手の１枚のカードを選択しゲームへ戻すことができる。,[2]. If [Chrono Transcendence Trap] is present on your side; once per opponent's turn you may Tribute this card to activate: Then choose 1 banished card (yours or your opponent's) and return it to play.

[3].このカードが墓地へ送られた時、自分フィールド上から２枚まで魔法・罠カードを墓地へ送って発動可能。その数x100ポイントだけ自分はLP(ライフポイント)回復する。,[3]. When this card is sent to the Graveyard; you may send up to 2 Spell/Trap Cards from your field to your Graveyard: Heal X x 100 Life Points (X = The number sent).

*Just before hitting 'send,' Gira leans back in his chair proudly—the thrill of crafting such potent words never gets old.*

"And there we go," *he murmurs under his breath,* "another slice of fiction brought vivid
